channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews

item.title: Self-professed 'nice kid' fatally mowed down Cranford girls at 70 mph, court papers say

item.title: As U.S. hiring slows, more Americans are job hunting for months
item.description: The number of unemployed people looking for work more than six months has surged to its highest level since 2021.

item.title: 10/2: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Government shutdown stretches into day two with no sign of deal; New book reflects on inequality, democracy, and values Americans share

item.title: PGA president Don Rea finally apologizes for Bethpage Black behavior at Ryder Cup
item.description: The PGA of America president has finally apologized for the unruly crowd behavior at Bethpage Black during the Ryder Cup

item.title: Government shutdown updates: Senate to reconvene Friday, as shutdown enters 3rd day
item.description: Vice President JD Vance, while speaking at a White House press briefing, said that he does not think the government shutdown will be long.

item.title: Supreme Court gears up for new term with cases on social issues, Trump policies

item.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs faces sentencing after conviction on prostitution-related charges
item.description: "In my life, I have made many mistakes, but I am no longer running from them," Combs wrote on Thursday in a letter to the judge overseeing his case.

item.title: Trump administration taps Army Reserve and National Guard for temporary immigration judges
item.description: The Trump administration is tapping National Guard and Army Reserve lawyers to be temporary immigration judges after firing dozens of existing judges.

item.title: FDA approves another generic abortion pill, prompting outrage from conservatives
WATCH: Part of high-rise apartment building collapses in New York City
item.description: An investigation is underway after an explosion in the Bronx caused part of a NYCHA apartment building to collapse on Wednesday morning.
